intro: Toona ciliata var. yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan toona, is a deciduous tree native to southwestern China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and alternate, simple leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in mountainous regions and is valued for its timber and traditional medicinal uses.
